value.title: Facial-recognition software fails to correctly identify people '96% of the time,' Detroit police chief says
value.excerpt: Facial-recognition technology misidentifies criminal suspects 96% of the time, according to the Detroit Police Chief.

value.title: Larry Magid: Facial recognition loses support as bias claims rise
value.excerpt: Following the lead of San Francisco, Boston and several other cities, Detroit is poised to end a contract with a company that provides facial recognition technology to its police department. And it’s not just Larry Magid (Gary Reyes / Mercury News) cities that are backing away from the technology.

value.title: My Invisalign app uses machine learning and facial recognition to sell the benefits of dental work

value.title: Raspberry Pi: Now computer-vision apps get boost with Khronos OpenVX API

value.title: Eye doctors getting more calls about Computer Vision Syndrome
value.excerpt: Some eye doctors across Eastern Iowa say they are getting more calls as the pandemic is forcing more people to work from home, staring at a computer all day. It’s causing what they call Computer Vision Syndrome.

value.title: Dozens of advocacy groups push for Congress to ban facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: Nearly 40 civil rights, privacy and technology groups sent a letter to Congressional leadership Thursday pushing for a federal moratorium on facial recognition technology.

value.title: The organizations positioned to lobby against a US ban on facial recognition
value.excerpt: Pressure on US lawmakers to create federal regulations on facial recognition has been mounting. Against that backdrop, industry groups have quietly lobbied to soften regulations and avoid an outright ban.

value.title: SuperAnnotate Announces Strategic Partnership With OpenCV to Improve Annotation for Computer Vision Workflows
value.excerpt: Annotated data is paramount for advances in self-driving cars, retail, healthcare and other industries; the market for data annotation tools is expected to reach $2.57 billion by 2027. Data preparation and engineering tasks represent over 80% of the time consumed in most AI and machine learning projects.
